author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: People do not wish to appear foolish; to avoid the appearance of foolishness, they are willing to remain actually fools.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: Poetry is the lifeblood of rebellion, revolution, and the raising of consciousness.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: Nobody is as powerful as we make them out to be.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: The fact is that when you do something from your heart, you leave a heart print.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: Yes, Mother. I can see you are flawed. You have not hidden it. That is your greatest gift to me.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: I grew up in the South under segregation. So, I know what terrorism feels like - when your father could be taken out in the middle of the night and lynched just because he didn't look like he was in an obeying frame of mind when a white person said something he must do. I mean, that's terrorism, too.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: It is because I recognize the brutality with which my own multi-branched ancestors have been treated that I can identify the despicable, lawless, cruel, and sadistic behavior that has characterized Israel's attempts to erase a people, the Palestinians, from their own land.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: I consider the fact that thousands of children die each day from starvation and a lack of medicine a crisis for humanity and a problem we must collectively attempt to solve.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: It is justice and respect that I want the world to dust off and put - without delay, and with tenderness - back on the head of the Palestinian child. It will be imperfect justice and respect because the injustice and disrespect have been so severe. But I believe we are right to try.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: In my work and in myself I reflect black people, women and men, as I reflect others. One day even the most self-protective ones will look into the mirror I provide and not be afraid.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: If you deny people their own voice, you'll have no idea of who they were.

author: Alice Walker
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story writer, poet, political activist
content: Is solace anywhere more comforting than that in the arms of a sister.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Bride: A woman with a fine prospect of happiness behind her.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Spring beckons! All things to the call respond; the trees are leaving and cashiers abscond.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: War is God's way of teaching Americans geography.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Politics: A strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles. The conduct of public affairs for private advantage.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Suffrage, noun. Expression of opinion by means of a ballot. The right of suffrage (which is held to be both a privilege and a duty) means, as commonly interpreted, the right to vote for the man of another man's choice, and is highly prized.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Cynic, n: a blackguard whose faulty vision sees things as they are, not as they ought to be.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Conservative, n: A statesman who is enamored of existing evils, as distinguished from the Liberal who wishes to replace them with others.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Future. That period of time in which our affairs prosper, our friends are true and our happiness is assured.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Sweater, n.: garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Laziness. Unwarranted repose of manner in a person of low degree.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Childhood: the period of human life intermediate between the idiocy of infancy and the folly of youth - two removes from the sin of manhood and three from the remorse of age.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: The hardest tumble a man can make is to fall over his own bluff.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Jealous, adj. Unduly concerned about the preservation of that which can be lost only if not worth keeping.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Saint: A dead sinner revised and edited.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Divorce: a resumption of diplomatic relations and rectification of boundaries.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Egotist: a person more interested in himself than in me.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Immortality: A toy which people cry for, And on their knees apply for, Dispute, contend and lie for, And if allowed Would be right proud Eternally to die for.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Alliance - in international politics, the union of two thieves who have their hands so deeply inserted in each other's pockets that they cannot separately plunder a third.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Love: A temporary insanity curable by marriage.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Cabbage: a familiar kitchen-garden vegetable about as large and wise as a man's head.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: A total abstainer is one who abstains from everything but abstention, and especially from inactivity in the affairs of others.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: What this country needs what every country needs occasionally is a good hard bloody war to revive the vice of patriotism on which its existence as a nation depends.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: An egotist is a person of low taste - more interested in himself than in me.

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: Happiness: an agreeable sensation arising from contemplating the misery of another.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Flying might not be all plain sailing, but the fun of it is worth the price.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: I want to do it because I want to do it.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Never do things others can do and will do if there are things others cannot do or will not do.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: The woman who can create her own job is the woman who will win fame and fortune.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Among all the marvels of modern invention, that with which I am most concerned is, of course, air transportation. Flying is perhaps the most dramatic of recent scientific attainment. In the brief span of thirty-odd years, the world has seen an inventor's dream first materialized by the Wright brothers at Kitty Hawk become an everyday actuality.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Aviation, this young modern giant, exemplifies the possible relationship of women and the creations of science. Although women have not taken full advantage of its use and benefits, air travel is as available to them as to men.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: I have often said that the lure of flying is the lure of beauty.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail their failure must be but a challenge to others.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: There are two kinds of stones, as everyone knows, one of which rolls.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Please know that I am aware of the hazards. I want to do it because I want to do it. Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail, their failure must be a challenge to others.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: In soloing - as in other activities - it is far easier to start something than it is to finish it.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: I have often been asked what I think about at the moment of take-off. Of course, no pilot sits and feels his pulse as he flies. He has to be part of the machine. If he thinks of anything but the task in hand, then trouble is probably just around the corner.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Women must pay for everything. They do get more glory than men for comparable feats, but, they also get more notoriety when they crash.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Better do a good deed near at home than go far away to burn incense.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: There is so much that must be done in a civilized barbarism like war.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Obviously I faced the possibility of not returning when first I considered going. Once faced and settled there really wasn't any good reason to refer to it.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Aviation offered such fun as crossing the continent in planes large and small, trying the whirling rotors of an autogiro, making record flights. With these activities came opportunity to know women everywhere who shared my conviction that there is so much women can do in the modern world and should be permitted to do irrespective of their sex.

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Mostly, my flying has been solo, but the preparation for it wasn't. Without my husband's help and encouragement, I could not have attempted what I have. Ours has been a contented and reasonable partnership, he with his solo jobs and I with mine. But always with work and play together, conducted under a satisfactory system of dual control.

author: Anais Nin
content: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: A leaf fluttered in through the window this morning, as if supported by the rays of the sun, a bird settled on the fire escape, joy in the task of coffee, joy accompanied me as I walked.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life, an individual meaning, an individual plot, like an individual novel, a book for each person.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: I will not be just a tourist in the world of images, just watching images passing by which I cannot live in, make love to, possess as permanent sources of joy and ecstasy.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: The human father has to be confronted and recognized as human, as man who created a child and then, by his absence, left the child fatherless and then Godless.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison with it, that was the miracle.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: There are many ways to be free. One of them is to transcend reality by imagination, as I try to do.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: Truth is something which can't be told in a few words. Those who simplify the universe only reduce the expansion of its meaning.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: I stopped loving my father a long time ago. What remained was the slavery to a pattern.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Anais Nin
content: My ideas usually come not at my desk writing but in the midst of living.
authorBirthname: Angela Anaïs Juana Antolina Rosa Edelmira Nin y Culmell

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Every good citizen makes his country's honor his own, and cherishes it not only as precious but as sacred. He is willing to risk his life in its defense and is conscious that he gains protection while he gives it.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Heaven will be no heaven to me if I do not meet my wife there.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Take time to deliberate; but when the time for action arrives, stop thinking and go in.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: You must pay the price if you wish to secure the blessing.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: The brave man inattentive to his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: The duty of government is to leave commerce to its own capital and credit as well as all other branches of business, protecting all in their legal pursuits, granting exclusive privileges to none.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is having lots to do and not doing it.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: It is to be regretted that the rich and powerful too often bend the acts of government to their own selfish purposes.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: The planter, the farmer, the mechanic, and the laborer... form the great body of the people of the United States, they are the bone and sinew of the country men who love liberty and desire nothing but equal rights and equal laws.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Any man worth his salt will stick up for what he believes right, but it takes a slightly better man to acknowledge instantly and without reservation that he is in error.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: I've got big shoes to fill. This is my chance to do something. I have to seize the moment.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Our government is founded upon the intelligence of the people. I for one do not despair of the republic. I have great confidence in the virtue of the great majority of the people, and I cannot fear the result.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: I have always been afraid of banks.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Peace, above all things, is to be desired, but blood must sometimes be spilled to obtain it on equable and lasting terms.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Elevate those guns a little lower.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Democracy shows not only its power in reforming governments, but in regenerating a race of men and this is the greatest blessing of free governments.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: All the rights secured to the citizens under the Constitution are worth nothing, and a mere bubble, except guaranteed to them by an independent and virtuous Judiciary.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: The great constitutional corrective in the hands of the people against usurpation of power, or corruption by their agents is the right of suffrage; and this when used with calmness and deliberation will prove strong enough.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Americans are not a perfect people, but we are called to a perfect mission.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: Fear not, the people may be deluded for a moment, but cannot be corrupted.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: There are no necessary evils in government. Its evils exist only in its abuses.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: We are beginning a new era in our government. I cannot too strongly urge the necessity of a rigid economy and an inflexible determination not to enlarge the income beyond the real necessities of the government.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: As long as our government is administered for the good of the people, and is regulated by their will; as long as it secures to us the rights of persons and of property, liberty of conscience and of the press, it will be worth defending.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: The people are the government, administering it by their agents; they are the government, the sovereign power.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: War is a blessing compared with national degradation.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andrew Jackson
authorOccupation: President of the United States, soldier, statesman
content: I weep for the liberty of my country when I see at this early day of its successful experiment that corruption has been imputed to many members of the House of Representatives, and the rights of the people have been bartered for promises of office.
authorBirthplace: Waxhaw Settlement between the Provinces of North Carolina and South Carolina, British America

author: Andy Warhol
content: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Isn't life a series of images that change as they repeat themselves?

author: Andy Warhol
content: In the future, everyone will be famous for 15 minutes.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Being born is like being kidnapped. And then sold into slavery.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Art is what you can get away with.

author: Andy Warhol
content: If you're not trying to be real, you don't have to get it right. That's art.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I'm for mechanical art. When I took up silk screening, it was to more fully exploit the preconceived image through the commercial techniques of multiple reproduction.

author: Andy Warhol
content: My fascination with letting images repeat and repeat - or in film's case 'run on' - manifests my belief that we spend much of our lives seeing without observing.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Everyone needs a fantasy.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Sex is more exciting on the screen and between the pages than between the sheets.

author: Andy Warhol
content: The most exciting attractions are between two opposites that never meet.

author: Andy Warhol
content: What's great about this country is that America started the tradition where the richest consumers buy essentially the same things as the poorest. You can be watching TV and see Coca-Cola, and you can know that the President drinks Coke. Liz Taylor drinks Coke, and just think, you can drink Coke, too.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Before I was shot, I always thought that I was more half-there than all-there - I always suspected that I was watching TV instead of living life. Right when I was being shot and ever since, I knew that I was watching television.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I am a deeply superficial person.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I'd asked around 10 or 15 people for suggestions. Finally one lady friend asked the right question, 'Well, what do you love most?' That's how I started painting money.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I like to work when I'm not working - do something that may not be considered work, but to me it's work. Getting exercise by going to the grocery store.

author: Andy Warhol
content: People sometimes say the way things happen in the movies is unreal, but actually, it's the way things happen to you in life that's unreal.

author: Andy Warhol
content: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Human beings are born solitary, but everywhere they are in chains - daisy chains - of interactivity. Social actions are makeshift forms, often courageous, sometimes ridiculous, always strange. And in a way, every social action is a negotiation, a compromise between 'his,' 'her' or 'their' wish and yours.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I have Social Disease. I have to go out every night. If I stay home one night I start spreading rumors to my dogs.

author: Andy Warhol
content: Dying is the most embarrassing thing that can ever happen to you, because someone's got to take care of all your details.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I just happen to like ordinary things. When I paint them, I don't try to make them extraordinary. I just try to paint them ordinary-ordinary.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I think everybody should like everybody.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I want to die with my blue jeans on.

author: Andy Warhol
content: I never understood why when you died, you didn't just vanish, everything could just keep going on the way it was only you just wouldn't be there. I always thought I'd like my own tombstone to be blank. No epitaph, and no name. Well, actually, I'd like it to say 'figment.'

author: Angela Davis
content: Jails and prisons are designed to break human beings, to convert the population into specimens in a zoo - obedient to our keepers, but dangerous to each other.

author: Angela Davis
content: As a black woman, my politics and political affiliation are bound up with and flow from participation in my people's struggle for liberation, and with the fight of oppressed people all over the world against American imperialism.

author: Angela Davis
content: I think the importance of doing activist work is precisely because it allows you to give back and to consider yourself not as a single individual who may have achieved whatever but to be a part of an ongoing historical movement.

author: Angela Davis
content: Racism, in the first place, is a weapon used by the wealthy to increase the profits they bring in by paying Black workers less for their work.

author: Angela Davis
content: To understand how any society functions you must understand the relationship between the men and the women.

author: Angela Davis
content: You can never stop and as older people, we have to learn how to take leadership from the youth and I guess I would say that this is what I'm attempting to do right now.

author: Angela Davis
content: Yes, I think it's really important to acknowledge that Dr. King, precisely at the moment of his assassination, was re-conceptualizing the civil rights movement and moving toward a sort of coalitional relationship with the trade union movement.

author: Angela Davis
content: What I think is different today is the lack of political connection between the black middle class and the increasing numbers of black people who are more impoverished than ever before.

author: Angela Davis
content: I'm involved in the work around prison rights in general.

author: Angela Davis
content: Radical simply means 'grasping things at the root.'

author: Angela Davis
content: What this country needs is more unemployed politicians.

author: Angela Davis
content: I think that has to do with my awareness that in a sense we all have a certain measure of responsibility to those who have made it possible for us to take advantage of the opportunities.

author: Angela Davis
content: Well I teach in the History of Consciousness Department at the University of California, Santa Cruz. So that's my primary work. I lecture on various campuses and in various communities across the country and other parts of the world.

author: Angela Davis
content: It's true that it's within the realm of cultural politics that young people tend to work through political issues, which I think is good, although it's not going to solve the problems.

author: Angela Davis
content: But at the same time you can't assume that making a difference 20 years ago is going to allow you to sort of live on the laurels of those victories for the rest of your life.

author: Angela Davis

authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: A deep sense of love and belonging is an irreducible need of all people. We are biologically, cognitively, physically, and spiritually wired to love, to be loved, and to belong. When those needs are not met, we don't function as we were meant to. We break. We fall apart. We numb. We ache. We hurt others. We get sick.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: I spent a lot of years trying to outrun or outsmart vulnerability by making things certain and definite, black and white, good and bad. My inability to lean into the discomfort of vulnerability limited the fullness of those important experiences that are wrought with uncertainty: Love, belonging, trust, joy, and creativity to name a few.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Social media has given us this idea that we should all have a posse of friends when in reality, if we have one or two really good friends, we are lucky.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: You're imperfect, and you're wired for struggle, but you are worthy of love and belonging.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: The difficult thing is that vulnerability is the first thing I look for in you and the last thing I'm willing to show you. In you, it's courage and daring. In me, it's weakness.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: The truth is: Belonging starts with self-acceptance. Your level of belonging, in fact, can never be greater than your level of self-acceptance, because believing that you're enough is what gives you the courage to be authentic, vulnerable and imperfect.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: When you get to a place where you understand that love and belonging, your worthiness, is a birthright and not something you have to earn, anything is possible.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Perfectionism is not the same thing as striving to be our best. Perfectionism is not about healthy achievement and growth; it's a shield.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Vulnerability is about showing up and being seen. It's tough to do that when we're terrified about what people might see or think.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Normally, when someone we love is turning away from a struggle, we self-protect by also turning away. That's definitely my first response. I think change is more likely to happen if both partners have common language and a shared lens to see problems.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: As unique as we all are, an awful lot of us want the same things. We want to shake up our current less-than-fulfilling lives. We want to be happier, more loving, forgiving and connected with the people around us.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: To me, a leader is someone who holds her- or himself accountable for finding potential in people and processes. And so what I think is really important is sustainability.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Vulnerability is the birthplace of connection and the path to the feeling of worthiness. If it doesn't feel vulnerable, the sharing is probably not constructive.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: If you think dealing with issues like worthiness and authenticity and vulnerability are not worthwhile because there are more pressing issues, like the bottom line or attendance or standardized test scores, you are sadly, sadly mistaken. It underpins everything.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Shame is the most powerful, master emotion. It's the fear that we're not good enough.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Live-tweeting your bikini wax is not vulnerability. Nor is posting a blow-by-blow of your divorce . That's an attempt to hot-wire connection. But you can't cheat real connection. It's built up slowly. It's about trust and time.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Through my research, I found that vulnerability is the glue that holds relationships together. It's the magic sauce.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Vulnerability is not weakness. And that myth is profoundly dangerous.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: What's the greater risk? Letting go of what people think - or letting go of how I feel, what I believe, and who I am?

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker

But good marriages are when you can go home and know that your vulnerability will be honored as courage, and that you'll find support.

author: Brene Brown
authorOccupation: Storyteller, Research Professor, Author, Public Speaker, Licensed Master Social Worker
content: Maybe stories are just data with a soul.

author: Brene Brown

content: I'm not a parenting expert. In fact, I'm not sure that I even believe in the idea of 'parenting experts.' I'm an engaged, imperfect parent and a passionate researcher. I'm an experienced mapmaker and a stumbling traveler. Like many of you, parenting is by far my boldest and most daring adventure.

author: Brian Tracy
content: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.

author: Brian Tracy
content: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.

author: Brian Tracy

author: Brian Tracy
content: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'

author: Budda
content: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.

author: Budda
content: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

author: Budda
content: What we think, we become.

author: Budda
content: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.

author: Budda
content: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.

author: Budda
content: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.

author: Budda
content: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.

author: Budda
content: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.

author: Budda
content: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.

author: Budda
content: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

author: Budda
content: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

author: Budda
content: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.

author: Budda
content: It is better to travel well than to arrive.

author: Budda
content: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.

author: Budda
content: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.

author: Budda
content: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.

author: Budda
content: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.

author: Budda
content: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.

author: Budda

author: Budda

author: Carl Jung

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: The universe seems neither benign nor hostile, merely indifferent.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: We have also arranged things so that almost no one understands science and technology. This is a prescription for disaster. We might get away with it for a while, but sooner or later this combustible mixture of ignorance and power is going to blow up in our faces.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: If we long to believe that the stars rise and set for us, that we are the reason there is a Universe, does science do us a disservice in deflating our conceits?

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright Brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: When you make the finding yourself - even if you're the last person on Earth to see the light - you'll never forget it.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: All of the books in the world contain no more information than is broadcast as video in a single large American city in a single year. Not all bits have equal value.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: The universe is not required to be in perfect harmony with human ambition.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: I am often amazed at how much more capability and enthusiasm for science there is among elementary school youngsters than among college students.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: I can find in my undergraduate classes, bright students who do not know that the stars rise and set at night, or even that the Sun is a star.

author: Carl Sagan
authorOccupation: Astronomer, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, science popularizer, science communicator
content: Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep thoughts can be winnowed from deep nonsense.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.

author: Carol Burnett
content: We don't stop going to school when we graduate.

author: Carol Burnett
content: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.

author: Carol Burnett
content: It's also selfish because it makes you feel good when you help others. I've been helped by acts of kindness from strangers. That's why we're here, after all, to help others.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Everybody I know who is funny, it's in them. You can teach timing, or some people are able to tell a joke, though I don't like to tell jokes. But I think you have to be born with a sense of humor and a sense of timing.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Because nobody goes through life without a scar.

author: Carol Burnett
content: My grandmother and I followed my mother here, to a house a block north of Hollywood Boulevard but a million miles away from Hollywood, if you know what I mean. We would hang out behind the ropes and look at the movie stars arriving at the premieres.

author: Carol Burnett
content: My grandmother and I would go see movies, and we'd come back to the apartment - we had a one-room apartment in Hollywood - and I would kind of lock myself in this little dressing room area with a cracked mirror on the door and act out what I had just seen.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I was once asked to do my Tarzan yell at Bergdorf Goodman, and a guard burst in with a gun! Now I only do it under controlled circumstances.

author: Carol Burnett
content: You have to go through the falling down in order to learn to walk. It helps to know that you can survive it. That's an education in itself.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Adolescence is just one big walking pimple.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I'm really not that funny in real life! But I am the best audience one could find. I love to laugh.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I'm glad I was born when I was. My time was the golden age of variety. If I were starting out again now, maybe things would happen for me, but it certainly would not be on a variety show with 28 musicians, 12 dancers, two major guest stars, 50 costumes a week by Bob Mackie. The networks just wouldn't spend the money today.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I love the writing. I love the idea of typing and seeing it on the computer and printing it out myself and, you know, moving sentences around. I like that.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I'm not always optimistic. You wouldn't have all cylinders cooking if you were always like Mary Poppins.

author: Carol Burnett
content: On the good days, my mother would haul out the ukulele and we'd sit around the kitchen table - it was a cardboard table with a linoleum top - and sing.

author: Carol Burnett
content: Celebrity was a long time in coming; it will go away. Everything goes away.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I don't have false teeth. Do you think I'd buy teeth like these?

author: Carol Burnett
content: Comedy is tragedy - plus time.

author: Carol Burnett
content: My grandmother and I saw an average of eight movies a week, double features, second run.

author: Carol Burnett
content: It costs a lot to sue a magazine, and it's too bad that we don't have a system where the losing team has to pay the winning team's lawyers.

author: Carol Burnett
content: You know, one wonderful thing that came out of my Enquirer experience is that, in my case, it was ruled tabloids are magazines. Which means they didn't have the protection that a newspaper has.

author: Carol Burnett
content: But I don't begrudge anybody, because I know how hard it is to have that dream and to make it happen, whether or not it's just to put a roof over your head and food on the table.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I wish my mother had left me something about how she felt growing up. I wish my grandmother had done the same. I wanted my girls to know me.

author: Carol Burnett
content: I think the hardest thing to do in the world, show-business-wise, is write comedy.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: We cannot seek achievement for ourselves and forget about progress and prosperity for our community... Our ambitions must be broad enough to include the aspirations and needs of others, for their sakes and for our own.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: We need to help students and parents cherish and preserve the ethnic and cultural diversity that nourishes and strengthens this community - and this nation.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Our language is the reflection of ourselves. A language is an exact reflection of the character and growth of its speakers.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Preservation of one's own culture does not require contempt or disrespect for other cultures.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: The fight is never about grapes or lettuce. It is always about people.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: You are never strong enough that you don't need help.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Students must have initiative; they should not be mere imitators. They must learn to think and act for themselves - and be free.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: There is no such thing as defeat in non-violence.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: From the depth of need and despair, people can work together, can organize themselves to solve their own problems and fill their own needs with dignity and strength.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: We draw our strength from the very despair in which we have been forced to live. We shall endure.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Real education should consist of drawing the goodness and the best out of our own students. What better books can there be than the book of humanity?

author: Cesar Chavez
content: There is no substitute for hard work, 23 or 24 hours a day. And there is no substitute for patience and acceptance.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: There are vivid memories from my childhood - what we had to go through because of low wages and the conditions, basically because there was no union. I suppose, if I wanted to be fair, I could say that I'm trying to settle a personal score. I could dramatize it by saying that I want to bring social justice to farm workers.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: In some cases non-violence requires more militancy than violence.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: When we are really honest with ourselves we must admit our lives are all that really belong to us. So it is how we use our lives that determines the kind of men we are.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: It is possible to become discouraged about the injustice we see everywhere. But God did not promise us that the world would be humane and just. He gives us the gift of life and allows us to choose the way we will use our limited time on earth. It is an awesome opportunity.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Though many of the poor have come to see the affluent middle class as its enemy, that class actually stands between the poor and the real powers in this society - the administrative octopus with its head in Washington, the conglomerates, the military complex.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: It is my deepest belief that only by giving our lives do we find life. I am convinced that the truest act of courage, the strongest act of manliness is to sacrifice ourselves for others in a totally non-violent struggle for justice.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: Who gets the risks? The risks are given to the consumer, the unsuspecting consumer and the poor work force. And who gets the benefits? The benefits are only for the corporations, for the money makers.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their heart.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: The end of all knowledge should be service to others.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: We farm workers are closest to food production. We were the first to recognize the serious health hazards of agriculture pesticides to both consumers and ourselves.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: To be a man is to suffer for others. God help us to be men!

author: Cesar Chavez
content: There is no law for farm labor organizing, save the law of the jungle.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: When poor people get involved in a long conflict, such as a strike or a civil rights drive, and the pressure increases each day, there is a deep need for spiritual advice. Without it, we see families crumble, leadership weaken, and hard workers grow tired.

author: Cesar Chavez
content: What we do know absolutely is that human lives are worth more than grapes and that innocent-looking grapes on the table may disguise poisonous residues hidden deep inside where washing cannot reach.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: A good wife is one who serves her husband in the morning like a mother does, loves him in the day like a sister does and pleases him like a prostitute in the night.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: God is not present in idols. Your feelings are your god. The soul is your temple.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Books are as useful to a stupid person as a mirror is useful to a blind person.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The world's biggest power is the youth and beauty of a woman.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Even if a snake is not poisonous, it should pretend to be venomous.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The biggest guru-mantra is: never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Purity of speech, of the mind, of the senses, and of a compassionate heart are needed by one who desires to rise to the divine platform.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: There is poison in the fang of the serpent, in the mouth of the fly and in the sting of a scorpion; but the wicked man is saturated with it.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Treat your kid like a darling for the first five years. For the next five years, scold them. By the time they turn sixteen, treat them like a friend. Your grown up children are your best friends.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: He who is overly attached to his family members experiences fear and sorrow, for the root of all grief is attachment. Thus one should discard attachment to be happy.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: A person should not be too honest. Straight trees are cut first and honest people are screwed first.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: It is better to die than to preserve this life by incurring disgrace. The loss of life causes but a moment's grief, but disgrace brings grief every day of one's life.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The one excellent thing that can be learned from a lion is that whatever a man intends doing should be done by him with a whole-hearted and strenuous effort.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Do not reveal what you have thought upon doing, but by wise council keep it secret being determined to carry it into execution.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The earth is supported by the power of truth; it is the power of truth that makes the sun shine and the winds blow; indeed all things rest upon truth.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: There is no austerity equal to a balanced mind, and there is no happiness equal to contentment; there is no disease like covetousness, and no virtue like mercy.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: As a single withered tree, if set aflame, causes a whole forest to burn, so does a rascal son destroy a whole family.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: He who lives in our mind is near though he may actually be far away; but he who is not in our heart is far though he may really be nearby.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: If one has a good disposition, what other virtue is needed? If a man has fame, what is the value of other ornamentation?

author: Chanakya
authorOccupation: advisor of Chandragupta Maurya, teacher, philosopher, economist, jurist
content: Once you start a working on something, don't be afraid of failure and don't abandon it. People who work sincerely are the happiest.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Depending on the story that you're telling, you can be relatable to everybody or nobody. I try and tell everybody's story.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: With 'Acid Rap,' I allowed myself to be really open-minded and free with who I allowed into my musical space. I wanted to make a cohesive product, but I also just want to make a bunch of dope songs inspired by whatever sounds I liked.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: There's a hunger in me that always wants to be creating and orating, telling people something and giving them information and getting feedback. There are so many questions that I'm trying to ask, and I'm still so far from being done saying what I gotta say.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Kanye took me from a kid who listened to music to a kid who lived music.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I don't know where people think I'm from, but I'm from Chicago. It's really just that. People wanna romanticize it and say, 'There's two sides to it, and it's a beautiful love/hate story of violence and music.' But it's really just a very scummy place where people don't have respect for other people's lives.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I think it's so dope that I'm here in Chicago and contributing to the music scene that's thriving. People are so happy Chicago's shining that everyone is willing to say 'I represent Chicago.' That wasn't always the case.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: The idea of 'talking white,' a lot of people grew up around that, just the idea that if you speak with proper diction and come off as educated that it's not black and that it's actually anti-black and should be considered only something that white people would do.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: It wasn't until I left that I realised it's not weird to grow up in certain cities and, by the age of 27 or 28, for all of your friends to still be alive. I can think of a lot of kids that I knew in Chicago who were supposed to grow up but didn't.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: When you're a Chicago artist, to play Lollapalooza, that's not a normal thing. It's artists on a path to a certain place that do that. Chief Keef did it; Kids These Days did it; Cool Kids did it. And I'm the next Cool-Kids-Chief, if you will.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I don't really like meetings, I like recording and performing music. I need to set myself up for when the time does come that I need better distribution or just a bigger team behind me.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Both of my parents graduated from high school, both attended college, both have government jobs now. They've always been very adamant about me finishing high school and finishing college.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I think even before I knew I wanted to be a rapper, I wanted to be an entertainer. I was really into Michael Jackson as a kid.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: There's nothing like doing a show at home. When you do a show in Chicago, there's just a certain love that you don't feel anywhere else; it's like home base.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: The weird thing about rap is that you don't get compared in the same way that athletes do, even though it's probably the most competitive sport in music. In basketball, they look at a player and say: 'This guy was the best in his prime at this sport.' But in rap it's not until you're dead or retired that people think about it like that.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: People wanna say that they're part Native American or mixed, or anything other than black. We're raised to believe that there's something better about not being fully black, something eccentric about it. I'm saying I used to tell girls that I was mixed, which is a bold-faced lie!

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Jeremih has been my favorite artist to collab with.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: 'Chance the Rapper' is many things. I'm constantly evolving.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: People always tell me I'm the complete opposite of Chief Keef and act like I'm supposed to stop him from making his music. But I like Chief Keef, so it's always super awkward. I just make music I like.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Fame or perceived success - it all comes from groupthink.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: Music can kind of make you one-dimensional. People see what's on the surface and what you rap about, and they make their decision on who you are from there.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: One of the first times I ever performed in front of a big group of people was at my kindergarten graduation. I did, like, a Michael Jackson impersonation as, like, a five year old. I had the suit and blazer, the glove and the fedora, and I just performed a whole Michael Jackson song. I'm sure it was 'Smooth Criminal.'

author: Chance The Rapper
content: The whole point of 'Acid Rap' was just to ask people a question: does the music business side of this dictate what type of project this is? If it's all original music and it's got this much emotion around it and it connects this way with this many people, is it a mixtape? What's an 'album' these days, anyways?

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I made the decision that I was going to make rap music in, like, fourth grade, so it's been something I was saying for a long time.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I'm light skinned, and I used to lean on that because that's something a lot of black people pride themselves on, and it's weird.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I don't really have control over my direct impression on people anymore. I used to be the person putting my CD in people's hands. But I'm kind of a mainstream artist now. Not by choice.

author: Chance The Rapper
content: I've never met Eminem; you don't meet Eminem. He has his own secret service.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Censorship is the tool of those who have the need to hide actualities from themselves and from others. Their fear is only their inability to face what is real, and I can't vent any anger against them; I only feel this appalling sadness. Somewhere in their upbringing, they were shielded against the total facts of our existence.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: We're all going to die, all of us; what a circus! That alone should make us love each other, but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities. We are eaten up by nothing.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: The male, for all his bravado and exploration, is the loyal one, the one who generally feels love. The female is skilled at betrayal and torture and damnation.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Some people never go crazy, What truly horrible lives they must live.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: It's possible to love a human being if you don't know them too well.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Humanity, you never had it to begin with.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: I don't like the clean-shaven boy with the necktie and the good job. I like desperate men, men with broken teeth and broken minds and broken ways. They interest me. They are full of surprises and explosions.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: We have wasted History like a bunch of drunks shooting dice back in the men's crapper of the local bar.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Never envy a man his lady. Behind it all lays a living hell.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: There will always be something to ruin our lives, it all depends on what or which finds us first. We are always ripe and ready to be taken.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Bad taste creates many more millionaires than good taste.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: What my character is or how many jails I have lounged in, or wards or walls or wassails, how many lonely-heart poetry readings I have dodged, is beside the point. A man's soul or lack of it will be evident with what he can carve upon a white sheet of paper.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Joan of Arc had style. Jesus had style.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: To do a dull thing with style-now that's what I call art.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: The female loves to play man against man. And if she is in a position to do it, there is not one who will resist.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: The thing that I fear discriminating against is humor and truth.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: Writers have to put up with this editor thing; it is ageless and eternal and wrong.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: A cat is only itself, representative of the strong forces of life that won't let go.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: I kept writing not because I felt I was so good, but because I felt they were so bad, including Shakespeare, all those. The stilted formalism, like chewing cardboard.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: If you want to know who your friends are, get yourself a jail sentence.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: I would be married, but I'd have no wife, I would be married to a single life.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: The free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: I can relax with bums because I am a bum. I don't like laws, morals, religions, rules. I don't like to be shaped by society.

author: Charles Bukowski
authorOccupation: Poet, novelist, short story writer, and columnist
content: I don't like jail, they got the wrong kind of bars in there.

author: Charles Darwin
content: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.

author: Charles Darwin
content: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, and not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.

author: Charles Darwin
content: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

author: Charles Darwin
content: Animals, whom we have made our slaves, we do not like to consider our equal.

author: Charles Darwin
content: False facts are highly injurious to the progress of science, for they often endure long; but false views, if supported by some evidence, do little harm, for every one takes a salutary pleasure in proving their falseness.

author: Charles Darwin
content: The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.

author: Charles Darwin
content: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.

author: Charles Darwin
content: The mystery of the beginning of all things is insoluble by us; and I for one must be content to remain an agnostic.

author: Charles Darwin

author: Doc Hastings
content: 137 years later, Memorial Day remains one of America's most cherished patriotic observances. The spirit of this day has not changed - it remains a day to honor those who died defending our freedom and democracy.

author: Doc Hastings
content: In remembering those who lost their lives in the London attacks and the September 11th attacks we continue our commitment to fighting for freedom, democracy and justice.

author: Doc Hastings
content: We owe our World War II veterans - and all our veterans - a debt we can never fully repay.

author: Doc Hastings
content: We know we must win the war on terror to protect innocent people and the freedoms that define our way of life.

author: Doc Hastings
content: In the over two centuries since the signing of the Declaration of Independence, millions of Americans have bravely served our nation in uniform so that all generations can continue to enjoy those same liberties.

author: Doc Hastings
content: In mid-May, the House of Representatives approved the full amount of money that the Veterans Administration said was needed for next year - plus an additional $1 billion increase for veterans' health care.

author: Doc Hastings
content: In the summer of 1776 our Founding Fathers sought to secure our independence and the liberties that remain the foundation of our nation today.

author: Doc Hastings
content: As long as every generation rises to its challenges and stands up in defense of liberty - as Americans have done in the past and as our men and women continue to do today - our nation will remain free and strong.

author: Doc Hastings
content: This is a form of double taxation and it's simply unfair.

author: Doc Hastings
content: Our region's economy was built upon their entrepreneurial spirit, and our economy still depends on the continued success of the enterprises they have worked so hard to create.

author: Doc Hastings

author: Doc Hastings
content: I am confident that in the end freedom and democracy will prevail over terror and tyranny. We will win this war on terror - and when we do Americans, the British, Iraqis, and people around the world will be more secure.

author: Doc Hastings

author: Doc Hastings

author: Doc Hastings
content: Since September 11th Congress has created the Department of Homeland Security, more than doubled the homeland security budget and implemented a bipartisan overhaul of our intelligence systems.

author: Doc Hastings

author: Doc Hastings
content: Leaving Iraq without military assistance during its transition, and before it is stable enough to ensure its own citizens' security, would pose a tremendous risk. We must complete our mission.

author: Doc Hastings
content: We will never forget and we will not relent until our job is done.

author: Doc Hastings
content: The most basic obligation we have to our veterans is that we keep the promises that were made to them. That is what makes the recent failures of the Veterans Administration so shameful.

author: Doc Hastings
content: Now Congress learns that the Veterans Administration failed to provide complete, accurate information on the money it needs for both this year and next year.

author: Doc Hastings
content: In addition to demanding answers and accountability from the Veterans Administration, Congress had to act to ensure veterans do not suffer because of the actions of a federal agency.

author: Doc Hastings
content: As efforts to fix this failure at the Veterans Administration continue, I also intend to persist in demanding answers and action on the establishment of a new clinic to serve the veterans in North Central Washington.

content: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.

content: History does not long entrust the care of freedom to the weak or the timid.

authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general

authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general

authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general
content: 'Worry' is a word that I don't allow myself to use.

authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general
content: Pessimism never won any battle.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general

authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general
content: Any man who wants to be president is either an egomaniac or crazy.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
authorOccupation: President of the United States, army general
content: Only our individual faith in freedom can keep us free.

author: e. e. cummings

author: e. e. cummings
content: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.

content: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.

content: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.

content: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance.

content: I imagine that yes is the only living thing.

author: e. e. cummings
content: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.

content: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.

author: e. e. cummings
content: Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination.
